General Practitioners (GPs) or Family Ph.description: Provide primary care and manage common illnesses, chronic diseases, and preventive care.

Cardiologists.description: Focus on heart-related issues (e.g., hypertension, heart disease).

Dermatologists.description: Handle skin, hair, and nail disorders (e.g., acne, eczema, psoriasis).

Endocrinologists.description: Treat hormonal disorders (e.g., diabetes, thyroid issues).

Gastroenterologists.description: Deal with digestive system conditions (e.g., ulcers, IBS).

Neurologists.description: Manage nervous system disorders (e.g., migraines, epilepsy).

Oncologists.description: Focus on cancer diagnosis and treatment.

Psychiatrists.description: Provide mental health care, including medication management for conditions like anxiety, depression, and schizophrenia.

Pulmonologists.description: Specialize in respiratory issues (e.g., asthma, COPD).

Rheumatologists.description: Treat autoimmune diseases and joint disorders (e.g., arthritis, lupus).

Urologists.description: Handle urinary tract and male reproductive issues (e.g., kidney stones, prostate problems).

Pediatricians.description: Provide medical care for infants, children, and adolescents.

Obstetricians and Gynecologists (OB/GYNs.description: Specialize in female reproductive health, pregnancy, and childbirth.

Psychologists.description: Provide counseling and therapy for mental health disorders, but cannot prescribe medication.

Allergists/Immunologists.description: Diagnose and treat allergies, asthma, and immune system disorders.

Orthopedic Surgeons.description: Focus on musculoskeletal conditions, though virtual consultations may primarily involve advice or pre-/post-surgery consultation.

ENT Specialists (Otolaryngologists).description: Treat conditions related to the ear, nose, and throat.

Ophthalmologists.description: Eye specialists who treat conditions like glaucoma, cataracts, and perform vision assessments.

Podiatrists.description: Treat foot, ankle, and lower extremity disorders.

Dietitians/Nutritionists.description: Provide advice on nutrition, diet plans, and managing health conditions through diet.

Physiotherapists.description: Offer advice and guidance on physical rehabilitation for injuries, post-surgery recovery, and chronic pain management.

Pharmacists (Clinical).description: Can offer consultations on medication management, drug interactions, and therapy optimization.

Occupational Therapists.description: Assist patients in managing daily activities affected by physical or mental health conditions.

Speech and Language Therapists.description: Help patients with speech, language, and communication disorders.

Radiologists.description: Can interpret imaging studies (e.g., X-rays, CT scans) and provide virtual consultations based on results.

Chiropractors.description: Provide consultations for spine and musculoskeletal conditions, particularly for pain management.

Psychiatric Nurse Practitioners.description: Provide mental health care, including prescribing medications and offering therapy for mental health conditions.

Geriatricians.description: Specialize in elderly care, managing age-related issues such as dementia, mobility problems, and chronic conditions.

Nephrologists.description: Manage kidney-related conditions, including chronic kidney disease and dialysis management.

Hematologists.description: Specialize in blood disorders such as anemia, leukemia, and clotting disorders.

Infectious Disease Specialists.description: Manage infections, including viral, bacterial, and parasitic infections (e.g., HIV, tuberculosis).

Pain Management Specialists.description: Provide care for chronic pain conditions, including non-surgical treatment options.

Public Health Practitioners.description: Offer advice on preventive care, vaccinations, and managing public health crises like epidemics.
